1.text: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt-sacrifices and peace-offerings before God.

2.text: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offerings and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

3.text: And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.

4.text: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to record, and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:

5.text: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;

6.text: Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.

7.text: Then on that day David delivered first this psalm to thank the LORD into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.

8.text: Give thanks to the LORD, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.

9.text: Sing to him, sing psalms to him, talk ye of all his wonderous works.

10.text: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

11.text: Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.

12.text: Remember his wonderful works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

13.text: O ye seed of Israel his servant, ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

14.text: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.

15.text: Be ye mindful always of his covenant; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations;

16.text: Even of the covenant which he made with Abraham, and of his oath to Isaac;

17.text: And which he confirmed to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,

18.text: Saying, To thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;

19.text: When ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.

20.text: And when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people;

21.text: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,

22.text: Saying, Touch not my anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

23.text: Sing to the LORD, all the earth; show forth from day to day his salvation.

24.text: Declare his glory among the heathen; his wonderful works among all nations.

25.text: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised: he also is to be feared above all gods.

26.text: For all the gods of the people are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.

27.text: Glory and honor are in his presence; strength and gladness are in his place.

28.text: Give to the LORD, ye kindreds of the people, give to the LORD glory and strength.

29.text: Give to the LORD the glory due to his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.

30.text: Fear before him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.

31.text: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men say among the nations, The LORD reigneth.

32.text: Let the sea roar, and the fullness thereof: let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.

33.text: Then shall the trees of the wood sing at the presence of the LORD, because he cometh to judge the earth.

34.text: O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.

35.text: And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, and glory in thy praise.

36.text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the LORD.

37.text: So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every dayâ€™s work required:

38.text: And Obed-edom with their brethren, sixty and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters:

39.text: And Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon,

40.text: To offer burnt-offerings to the LORD upon the altar of the burnt-offering continually morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the law of the LORD, which he commanded Israel;

41.text: And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever;

42.text: And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were porters.

43.text: And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
